Message.Title: TRADING HALT @2pm.....till TUE
Message.Msg: For example, Black Monday (Monday October 19, 1987) was a day where many world markets crashed and were losing a huge amount of value in a very short period of time. The Dow Jones Industrial Average dropped by 22.61% that day. Following this event the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) put limits in place to reduce market volatility and huge sell-offs. At the beginning of each quarter the average closing price of the Dow Jones Industrial Average is figured and circuit breakers or “stock market trading curbs” are set at 10%, 20%, and 30% of that average closing price. Different rules apply depending on which circuit breaker is triggered. If the 10% level is hit during the day a 1 hour halt is applied. A 2 hour halt is for the 20% level and if the Dow Jones loses 30% in 1 day, the market is halted for the day.
